25 // Class definitions
28 struct PBRProperties {
29  // PBR Extension
30  // http://exocortex.com/blog/extending_wavefront_mtl_to_support_pbr
31  real_g m_roughness = 0.0; // [0, 1] default 0
32  real_g m_metallic = 0.0; // [0, 1] default 0
33  real_g m_sheen = 0.0; // [0, 1] default 0
34  real_g m_clearcoatThickness = 0.0; // [0, 1] default 0
35  real_g m_clearcoatRoughness = 0.0; // [0, 1] default 0
36  real_g m_anisotropy = 0.0; // aniso. [0, 1] default 0
37  real_g m_anisotropyRotation = 0.0; // anisor. [0, 1] default 0
38 };
39 
42 struct MaterialProperties {
43 
44  MaterialProperties();
45  ~MaterialProperties();
46 
47  //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
50 
52 
53  Vector3 m_ambient; // Base color of texture
54  Vector3 m_diffuse; // Diffuse color of texture
55  Vector3 m_specularity; // (reflectivity) Specular reflection, effects color intensity of specular reflection
56  Vector3 m_transmittance; // Transmission filter of the object, 0 1 0 would allow all green through, no red or blue
57  Vector3 m_emission; // same as luminosity, self-illumination
58  real_g m_shininess = 1.0; // Same as glossiness, shine dampening, exponent that approximates surface glossiness for specular reflection
59  real_g m_ior = 1.0; // index of refraction, also known as optical density, from 0.001 to 10, 0.001 does not bend light, glass = 1.5, want >1
60  real_g m_dissolve = 1.0; // (opacity) how much material dissolves into background, 1 == opaque; 0 == fully transparent
61  // Does not depend on material thickness, unlike real transparent material
62 
63  // TODO: Create a flag for something similar in material, control:
64  // 1) Shadow casting
65  // 2) Transparency
66  // 3) Visibility
67  // // NOTE, unused. Illumination model (see http://www.fileformat.info/format/material/)
68  uint32_t m_illum = 0;
69 
71  PBRProperties m_pbr;
72 };
73
